column19: Polar Class ( International Classification Society/Unified Requirements for Polar Class Ships)

column15: Two MTU 16V-4000 and two MTU 12V-4000 Diesels
column20: Operated by University of Alaska Fairbanks. Two Wartsila azipods
Operated by Atomflot. Three in line shafts. Hangar and pad for one helicopter
Operated by Atomflot. Three in line shafts. Hangar and pad for one helicopter
Operated by Atomflot. Three in line shafts. Hangar and pad for one helicopter
Operated by Swedish Maritime Organization. Water lubrication for icebreaking.
Operated by Alfred Wegner Instititute. Has capability to carry one helicopter

column15: Two Bergen B33:45L6A and two Bergen B33:45L6A Diesels
column20: Operated by British Antarctic Survey. Capability to carry two helicopters. Two 5 bladed variable pitch propellers.
USCGS largest vessel. Capacity for two helicopters in hangar and deployable RHIB

column15: Six Alco 16V-251F Diesels and Three Pratt & Whitney FT-4A12 gas turbines
column20: USCGS recommisioned in 2012-12-01.  Sister ship to the Polar Sea. Supported operation Deep Freeze in Antarctica
Operated by the South African Department of Forestry, Fisheries and the Environment
Operated by ESL shipping as an oceanogoing barge/pusher combination. One bow thruster.
Operated by the Canadian Coast Guard. Facilities for two helicopters and one RHIB. Three shafts with fixed pitch props.
Operated by Atomflot.  Can carry 74 lighters. One shaft with adjust pitch propellor. Steam turbine.
